nodes.speaker: Hel
nodes.text: So. This is the soul Loki drags from frost and fate. You stand before Hel—queen of rot, keeper of endings—and still your spine forgets how to bend. Tell me, {name}: is it pride that holds you upright… or ignorance?

nodes.speaker: Hel
nodes.text: Good. Instinct survives where wisdom fails. Rise. But do not confuse respect with safety—mercy does not live long in my halls.

nodes.speaker: Hel
nodes.text: Mm. Defiance. A pretty word for those who have not yet paid its cost. In Dreadheim, pride is carved away—slowly—until only scars remember it existed.

nodes.speaker: Hel
nodes.text: Do not mistake fire for kindness, {name}. Even the hearth in Dreadheim bites the careless. Speak now. Why do you stain my hall with your breath?

nodes.speaker: Hel
nodes.text: Ah. Volume instead of value. Dangerous, but honest. Sit, then. Let the benches weigh you… and decide how long you belong among the living.

nodes.speaker: Hel
nodes.text: Silence. The language of those who listen before they strike. Stand still, then. Dreadheim will speak for you.

nodes.speaker: Hel
nodes.text: Watch them closely. The first to smile are always starving. And you… you look like someone testing how much sin the room will forgive.

choices.label: Wait until Hel isn’t looking and steal her amulet.

nodes.speaker: Hel
nodes.text: …Interesting. Courage that borders on madness. That amulet is hunger bound in iron and memory. Take it—if you are prepared to be followed by everything it remembers.

nodes.speaker: Hel
nodes.text: Flattery. Either a blade seeking a soft place… or a soul afraid to draw blood. Still—you chose words over theft. That restraint will either save you… or delay your ruin.

nodes.speaker: Hel
nodes.text: Loki trades in debts. I collect them. If you wish to bear Dreadheim’s mark, you will earn it not in glory—but in choices. Small ones. Quiet ones. The kind that rot… or harden into legend.
